Class MeanValue

        public void ponderate()
               throws JPARSECException

      • getMeanArithmeticValue

        public double getMeanArithmeticValue()
                              throws JPARSECException

        Returns:
        Mean arithmetic value.
        Throws:

      • getAverageValue

        public double getAverageValue()
        Returns the mean value of a set of values, defined as the sum of the components divided by the number of them.
        Returns:
        Mean value.

      • getMedian

        public double getMedian()
        Returns the median of the input data. In an array of 10 elements this is equivalent to sort them and return the 5th element. Errors in the measures are not taken into account.
        Returns:
        The median.

      • getAverageUsingMeanAndMedian

        public double getAverageUsingMeanAndMedian(double sigmas)
        Average the values that are within a given 'sigmas' of the median. This algorithm is adequate when input array is long, at least 15 values. Errors in the measures are not taken into account.
        Parameters:
        sigmas - Number of sigmas from the median, positive. Less sigmas would take less values.
        Returns:
        The average value.

      • getAverageUsingKappaSigmaClipping

        public double getAverageUsingKappaSigmaClipping(double sigmas,
                                       int iter)
        Kappa-sigma clipping algorithm. We start with a robust estimator: the median. Then, we eliminate the values that are more than sigmas away from the median. For the remaining values, we calculate the mean and variance, and iterate (with the mean replacing the median) until no values are eliminated or the number of iterations is reached. This algorithm is relatively slow but works well for input arrays of length 10-15. Errors in the measures are not taken into account.
        Parameters:
        sigmas - Number of sigmas from the median/mean, positive. Less sigmas would take less values.
        iter - Maximum number of iterations. Set to 0 or negative to iterate until convergency.
        Returns:
        The result of the sigma clipping average.

      • getDispersion

        public double getDispersion()
        Returns the dispersion in the input values respect the average of the values.
        Returns:
        Math.sqrt(SUM((x_i - mean)^2) / n);

      • getMeasuredAverageValue

        public MeasureElement getMeasuredAverageValue()
        Returns a simple average value using the average value as measure, and the dispersion as error. To call method ponderate() is not required.
        Returns:
        Average value and dispersion.

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        For unit testing only.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
